gui.tooltip.show-workspace-key: Press this key to display the main StardewModSmithy UI.
gui.tooltip.author-name: The default author name to use for packs created via this mod.
gui.tooltip.autosave-frequency: How frequently to automatically save your changes.
gui.tooltip.auto-symlink-reload:
When a new content pack is created, automatically install it.
After the game is relaunched, automatically performs a reload when a content pack is saved.
gui.tooltip.is-loaded: This content pack is loaded, it will be automatically reloaded on save.
gui.tooltip.not-loaded: This content pack is not loaded yet, restart the game to enable automatic reload on save.
gui.paragraph.about.0: StardewModSmithy is a tool for creating your own Content Patcher mods. It happens to be a SMAPI mod itself.
gui.paragraph.about.1: Before you publically release your mod, you should ensure you have proper permission to all other assets you wish to use in your mod. You should only use original assets, assets with open permissions, and/or assets that you have obtained usage permissions for from their original creators.
gui.paragraph.about.2: If you used any AI generated assets, please clearly state that AI was involved in the creation of your mod.
gui.paragraph.faq.0.q: Where can I put the PNG textures for this tool?
gui.paragraph.faq.0.a.0: The Textures tab lists all the textures that the tool is aware of, and has a button to take you to the input textures folder. Whenever you move files into the folder, you should press the refresh button to update the list.
gui.paragraph.faq.0.a.1: When textures are loaded, any subfolders of loose PNGs in the input textures folder will be automatically merged into 1 PNG atlas which can be used to quickly populate furniture mods.
gui.paragraph.faq.1.q: How do I release my content packs?
gui.paragraph.faq.1.a: The packs listed in the Packs tab each have button which will take you to the folder of that pack which you can compress and release.
gui.paragraph.faq.2.q: Can I add any extra changes to my content packs?
gui.paragraph.faq.2.a.0: Yes, but with some special notes on how:
gui.paragraph.faq.2.a.1: 1. When saving a content pack via the tool, anything in 'assets' and 'data' subfolders will be overwritten, along with anything inside "Changes" in the content.json.
gui.paragraph.faq.2.a.2: 2. You must put all special content patcher JSON includes inside the 'custom' subfolder. All JSONs in this folder are automatically included in the main content.json.
gui.paragraph.faq.2.a.3: 3. "ConfigSchema" and "DynamicTokens" still go in the main content.json and they will be preserved between saving.
gui.paragraph.faq.2.a.4: 4. i18n translations are preserved between saving.
gui.paragraph.faq.3.a: This folder is used to install content packs created by this tool, so that they can be automatically . This feature generally conflicts with mod managers, so it is recommended to launch game directly.
gui.paragraph.faq.4.a.0: You may use the content packs created by this mod for any purpose so as long as you do not remove the "StardewModSmithyInfo" section in the generated manifest.
gui.paragraph.faq.4.a.1:
This disclaimer is not applicable to any other assets packaged in the content pack. It only covers the JSON files generated by StardewModSmithy.
See "StardewModSmithyInfo.Generated" in the manifest for details.
